Unnamed: 2: Definitions
Sources from which information is communicated through text or words, such as books, articles, reports, websitesetc.
A written document dating from ancient history
A group of documents or objects, often historical and related to a specific topic or from a specific source
A regularly updated online source, often dedicated to a specific subject and usually written in an informal or conversational style
A self-contained, written work, which in physical form is bound with covers, and is normally edited and published for distribution
A defined section of a book, usually specified with its own title or number
An organised collection of structured information or data, typically stored digitally
A book or set of books which gives information on many subjects, typically arranged alphabetically
A video or audio work which has been deliberately produced and edited for distribution to an audience
A document produced by and/or for the government, for example, relating to laws and official regulations on the treatment of heritage
A written work which is published in an academic periodical, i.e. a publication which is produced and distributed at regular intervals and is normally peer-reviewed
An audio or video report produced and distributed to the public by a news organisation, on television, radio, or the internet
A written work which is published in periodicals that are not peer-reviewed (see Journal Article), such as magazines or newsletters
A written or verbal exchange between two people, often informal
A written report about the activities of a project, group, etc. which has been published in print or online
Applications or websites where users share information online, often informally
A written work or audio-visual presentation which has been produced and perhaps presented to an audience but has not yet been published
A written report about the activities of a project, group, etc. which has not been published in print or online
Collected documents and information accessed through an internet browser
Sources which are visual or symbolic representations of geographical space, such as maps, plans, elevations, etc.
A drawing or photograph which specifically records the vertical face of a structure or the side of an excavated trench
A visual or symbolic representation of a geographical area, often showing the shape and position of physical features of the landscape
A drawing or photograph which records a horizontal area

Sources which capture visual representations of physical landscapes, strutures, objects, etc. such as photographs, satellite imagery, etc. (but NOT including site plans or section drawings which come under Cartography)
An assemblage of aerial photographs which have been combined to create a larger image
A photograph of the earth's surface which has been taken from an airborne vehicle, such as airplane, kite, or UAV

A likeness, diagram, or representation of an object or scene, produced manually (e.g. pencil on paper) or digitally. Ruined or missing parts may be filled in, based on evidence, extrapolation, or imagination.
An image captured directly by a camera onto a light-sensitive surface or digitally
An image captured of the earth by an imaging system which operates from a satellite.
Satellite imagery which is accessed via an online virtual globe or map software, e.g. Google Earth or Bing Maps, where metadata and information for individual images is generally unavailable
An recording of moving visual images captured on film or digitally
See 'Shared Dataset'

A set of data which has been officially shared with EAMENA from other individuals, institutions, or projects, such as survey or excavation results before publication. These data are normally unpublished; if the data are published, they should be recorded under Bibliography.
Definitions
An audio recording accessed as a digital file, e.g. mp3
A collection of data organised and stored in a digital document or platform e.g. spreadsheet, database software or platform
A digital text document, e.g. PDF, eBook, word document
A drawing or model created and viewed using digital software, e.g. Illustrator, AutoCAD, Photoscan
A 3-dimensional digital representation of elevation data to represent terrain
An image accessed as a digital file, e.g. jpeg, tiff
A video recording accessed as a digital file, e.g. mp4
Plastic strips onto which photographic images are captured through light exposure with a camera, usually with colours inverted
A digital TIFF image file which has georeferencing information embedded within the file
Glass plates onto which photographic images are captured through light exposure with a camera. Their use preceded the use of plastic film in modern cameras (see Film Negative)
A digital file used to display geographic data in an earth browser such as Google Earth
Data viewed via the internet through a web browser or platform
Digital data files used in GIS software other than shapefile (.shp), such as rasters
Data format unspecified or not listed here
A written or verbal exchange between two people, often informal, e.g. an e-mail or telephone call
Any physical document or object, such as books, photographs, etc.
A digital geospatial vector data file for GIS software
An individual transparent image intended for projection onto a larger screen using a slide projector
Last Name, Initials
Date of publication. In yyyy-mm-dd format. Put 1st of January for year (unless otherwise known)
Title of Book/Article/Document, etc. Required field. As given, without capitalization
Editor of edited volume, if applicable
Title of Periodical/Edited Volume, etc., if applicable. Full unabbreviated name
Place of publication. City, Country format
Name of Publishing Body, full unabbreviated name
Periodical Volume number, if applicable
Periodical Issue number, if applicable/ OR Edition
Page Range, use full numbers
Name/Number of figure, if applicable. Only if the Information Resource refers to a specific figure.
Name of person/contact/institution who has supplied data
Name of the affiliation or copyright type
Name of project from which data has been shared

Information Resource: Shared Data Source Date of Creation
Unnamed: 2: Date; use 1 January if only year known
URL of the website, without http://
Date source was (last) accessed, in yyyy-mm-dd format. Use '01' where month or year unknown
**See Geometries Tab in other Glossary document
